st is a list of evidence-based practices, organized into four different pause points. 
Based on WHO guidelines, the items on the Checklist help prevent the major worldwide 
causes of maternal deaths, intrapartum-related stillbirths and neonatal deaths (including  
haemorrhage, infection, obstructed labour and hypertensive disorders and complications of 
prematurity). Each task on the Checklist is a crucial action that, if missed, can result in severe 
harm for the mother, the newborn, or both.
